organizationName.en: Department of lnformation and Communications Engineering

workload.fi: Luennot, itseopiskelu, laskuharjoitukset, kotitehtävät.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, självständigt arbete, räkneövningar, hemuppgifter
workload.en: Lectures, self study, exercise hours, home assignments

prerequisites.fi: Yliopistomatematiikan ja fysiikan perustiedot.  Esimerkiksi differentiaaliyhtälöiden peruskurssi.
prerequisites.sv: Grundkurser i matematik och fysik i universitetsnivå.  T.ex. Grundkurs i differentialekvationer.
prerequisites.en: Basic knowledge of university level mathematics and physics.  For example: Basic course of differential equations.

learningOutcomes.fi: Opiskelija hallitsee jatkuva-aikaisen säätö- ja systeemiteorian alkeet. Hän ymmärtää dynaamisen järjestelmän perusperiaatteet ja analysointimenetelmät. Hän osaa analysoida yksinkertaisten järjestelmien dynaamista käyttäytymistä sekä osaa suunnitella erityyppisillä menetelmillä stabiloivan säätöratkaisun. Hän osaa simuloimalla tarkistaa suljetun systeemin käyttäytymisen.
learningOutcomes.sv: Studeranden behärskar reglering i kontinuerlig tid, regler-och systemteorins grunder. Hon/han behärskar grundprinciperna och analysmetoder för dynamiska system. Hon/han kan planera stabiliserande regulatorer med olika metoder och säkra det slutna systemets operation analytiskt och med simulering.
learningOutcomes.en: The student masters the basics of continuous-time control theory and understands the principles and analysis methods of dynamical systems. She/he can design controllers by different methods and verify the operation of the closed loop system by analytical means and through simulation.

content.fi: Säätö- ja systeemiteorian perusteet. Dynaamiset järjestelmät ja niiden käyttäytyminen. Siirtofunktiot ja taajuustason mallit. Tilamallit. PID-säädin. Säätäjien suunnittelu ja analyysi.   Dynaamisen takaisinkytketyn järjestelmän simulointi. Digitaalisäädön alkeet.  Harjoitustehtävissä käytetään Matlab/Control System Toolboxia sekä Simulinkiä.
content.sv: Grunder i analog reglering. Dynamiska system. Frekvensplanets modeller. Tillståndsmodeller. Planering och analys av regulatorer. PID regulator. Grunder i digital reglering. I övningarna används Matlab/Control System Toolbox och Simulink.
content.en: Fundamentals of analogue control. Dynamical systems. Frequency domain models. State space models. Design and analysis of control systems. The PID controller. Basic principles of digital control. In the exercises the Matlab/Control System Toolbox and Simulink are used.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kaksi välikoetta tai tentti.  Arvosteltavia kotitehtäviä sekä luentotehtävät.
assesmentMethods.sv: Två mellanförhör eller en tentamen. Hem- och föreläsningsuppgifter, som bedöms.
assesmentMethods.en: Two intermediate exams or final exam.  Home assignments and lecture problems, which are assessed

additionalInformation.fi: Vain toinen kursseista ELEC-C1230 Säätötekniikka ja ELEC-C8201 Control and Automation voidaan hyväksyä tutkintoon. Jos kurssi ELEC-C1230 Säätötekniikka kuuluu opiskelijan pää- tai sivuaineen opintoihin, sitä ei voi pää- tai sivuaineessa korvata kurssilla ELEC-C8201 Control and Automation. Opetuskieli : suomi Opetusperiodi : 2022-2023 Kevät III - IV  2023-2024 Kevät III - IV Ilmoittautuminen : Opetukseen ilmoittaudutaan Sisussa (sisu.aalto.fi).
additionalInformation.sv: Bara det andra av kursserna ELEC-C1230 Reglerteknik och ELEC-C8201 Control and Automation kan bli tillgodoräknad till studierna. Om kursen ELEC-C1230 Reglerteknik ingår till studentens huvud- eller sidoämne, kan man inte ersätta den i huvud- eller sidoämne med ELEC-C8201 Control and Automation.  Undervisningsspråket : finska Undervisningsperiod : 2022-2023 Vår III - IV  2023-2024 Vår III - IV Anmälning : Anmälan till undervisning sker i Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi).
additionalInformation.en: Only one of the courses ELEC-C1230 Control Engineering and ELEC-C8201 Control and Automation can be included in the degrees. If the course ELEC-C1230 Control Engineering is a part of student's major or minor studies it can't be substituted for the course ELEC-C8201 Control and Automation. Teaching Language : Finnish Teaching Period : 2022-2023 Spring III - IV  2023-2024 Spring III - IV Enrollment : Registration for the course is done in Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi).

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Basic university mathematics, signals and systems, basics of programming, boolean algebra, matrix algebra, Matlab
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Basic university mathematics, signals and systems, basics of programming, boolean algebra, matrix algebra, Matlab
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Basic university mathematics, signals and systems, basics of programming, boolean algebra, matrix algebra, Matlab

learningOutcomes.fi: Principles and analysis methods of dynamical systems.  Design of controllers by different methods and verification of performance.  Understanding of hardware and software architectures of automation systems.  Programming languages of programmable logic controllers.  Design methods and simulation
learningOutcomes.sv: Principles and analysis methods of dynamical systems.  Design of controllers by different methods and verification of performance.  Understanding of hardware and software architectures of automation systems.  Programming languages of programmable logic controllers.  Design methods and simulation
learningOutcomes.en: Principles and analysis methods of dynamical systems.  Design of controllers by different methods and verification of performance.  Understanding of hardware and software architectures of automation systems.  Programming languages of programmable logic controllers.  Design methods and simulation

content.fi: Representation of dynamical systems (transfer functions, state-space representation), simple modelling and parameter estimation, the control problem, negative feedback, stability, PID controller, state controllers, frequency domain techniques, compensators, introduction to digital controllers.  Basic structures of automation systems.  Sensors and automation networks.  Automation programming
content.sv: Representation of dynamical systems (transfer functions, state-space representation), simple modelling and parameter estimation, the control problem, negative feedback, stability, PID controller, state controllers, frequency domain techniques, compensators, introduction to digital controllers.  Basic structures of automation systems.  Sensors and automation networks.  Automation programming
content.en: Representation of dynamical systems (transfer functions, state-space representation), simple modelling and parameter estimation, the control problem, negative feedback, stability, PID controller, state controllers, frequency domain techniques, compensators, introduction to digital controllers.  Basic structures of automation systems.  Sensors and automation networks.  Automation programming

assesmentMethods.fi: Intermediate exams or full exam, home assignments which are assessed
assesmentMethods.sv: Intermediate exams or full exam, home assignments which are assessed
assesmentMethods.en: Intermediate exams or full exam, home assignments which are assessed

learningOutcomes.fi: Principles and analysis methods of dynamical systems.  Design of controllers by different methods and verification of performance.  Understanding of hardware and software architectures of automation systems.  Programming languages of programmable logic controllers.  Design methods and simulation
learningOutcomes.sv: Principles and analysis methods of dynamical systems.  Design of controllers by different methods and verification of performance.  Understanding of hardware and software architectures of automation systems.  Programming languages of programmable logic controllers.  Design methods and simulation
learningOutcomes.en: Principles and analysis methods of dynamical systems.  Design of controllers by different methods and verification of performance.  Understanding of hardware and software architectures of automation systems.  Programming languages of programmable logic controllers.  Design methods and simulation

content.fi: Representation of dynamical systems (transfer functions, state-space representation), simple modelling and parameter estimation, the control problem, negative feedback, stability, PID controller, state controllers, frequency domain techniques, compensators, introduction to digital controllers.  Basic structures of automation systems.  Sensors and automation networks.  Automation programming
content.sv: Representation of dynamical systems (transfer functions, state-space representation), simple modelling and parameter estimation, the control problem, negative feedback, stability, PID controller, state controllers, frequency domain techniques, compensators, introduction to digital controllers.  Basic structures of automation systems.  Sensors and automation networks.  Automation programming
content.en: Representation of dynamical systems (transfer functions, state-space representation), simple modelling and parameter estimation, the control problem, negative feedback, stability, PID controller, state controllers, frequency domain techniques, compensators, introduction to digital controllers.  Basic structures of automation systems.  Sensors and automation networks.  Automation programming

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: ELEC-A7100
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: ELEC-A7100
prerequisites.en: Suositellut esitiedot: ELEC-A7100

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
• osaa selittää tietoverkkojen käsitteet sekä pakettiverkkojen periaatteet
• osaa selittää Internet-protokollapinon ja sen keskeisimpien protokollien toiminnan.
• ymmärtää reitityksen ongelmista ja osaa yleisimmät reititysalgoritmit ja -protokollat.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avklarad kurs kan den studerande• förklara begreppen inom datornätverk och principerna för paketväxlande nätverk.• förklara begreppet Internet-protokollstack och de viktigaste funktionerna med Internet-protokoll.• förstå olika problem med routing och känna till routingprotokoll samt de vanligaste algoritmer för routing.
learningOutcomes.en: Upon completing the course, the student will be able to: • explain the concepts of computer networks and the principles of packet networks• understand the concepts of the Internet protocol stack and the functioning of key protocols• understand the basics of routing and be familiar with the most common routing algorithms and protocols.

content.fi: Pakettiverkkojen periaatteet ja keskeiset käsitteet, Protokollapinon käsite, Linkkikerros sen tehtävät ja protokollat. Tärkeimmät MAC-algoritmit. Internet-protokollapino ja keskeisimmät, erilaiset reititysmenetelmät ja periaatteet. Tietoverkon suorituskyvyn arviointi.
content.sv: Principer och centrala begrepp för paketnätverk, Begreppet protokollstack (OSI-referensmodellen), Datalänknivå och dess uppgifter samt protokoll, Centrala MAC-algoritmer. Internet-protokollstack samt de viktigaste routingalgoritmerna och protokollen. Evaluering av datornätverkens prestanda.
content.en: Principles and key concepts of packet switched networks, Concept of the protocol stack. Link layer: its functions and protocols. Main MAC-algorithms. Internet protocol stack. Main routing principles, algorithms, and protocols. Evaluation of the performance of the computer networks.

assesmentMethods.fi: Pakolliset: Tentti, harjoitustehtävät
assesmentMethods.sv: Obligatoriska: Tentamen, räkneövningar
assesmentMethods.en: Mandatory: Exam, exercises

Jos kurssi ELEC-C7241 Tietokoneverkot kuuluu opiskelijan pää- tai sivuaineen opintoihin, sitä ei voi pää- tai sivuaineessa korvata kurssilla ELEC-C7420 Basic Principles in Networking. Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Kevät III - IV  2025-2026 Kevät III - IV
additionalInformation.sv: Bara det andra av kursserna ELEC-C7241 Datornät och ELEC-C7420 Basic Principles in Networking kan bli tillgodoräknad till studierna. Om kursen ELEC-C7241 Datornät ingår till studentens huvud- eller sidoämne, kan man inte ersätta den i huvud- eller sidoämne med ELEC-C7420 Basic Principles in Networking. Undervisningsspråket: finska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Vår III - IV  2025-2026 Vår III - IV

If the course ELEC-C7241 Computer Networks is a part of student's major or minor studies it can't be substituted for the course ELEC-C7420 Basic Principles in Networking. prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: - Teachers highly recommend students to learn basics in Linux before taking this course. One option is to take ELEC-A7310 Linux Basics. - Basic programming skills are needed. Students are expected to have taken at least one programming course, e.g. CS-A1113 Basics in Programming Y1.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: - Teachers highly recommend students to learn basics in Linux before taking this course. One option is to take ELEC-A7310 Linux Basics. - Basic programming skills are needed. Students are expected to have taken at least one programming course, e.g. CS-A1113 Basics in Programming Y1.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: - Teachers highly recommend students to learn basics in Linux before taking this course. One option is to take ELEC-A7310 Linux Basics. - Basic programming skills are needed. Students are expected to have taken at least one programming course, e.g. CS-A1113 Basics in Programming Y1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
At the end of this course, you will be able to
  • Describe the basic principles of TCP/IP model and the representative protocols at each layer
  • Use network diagnostic tools to analyze the working mechanisms and performance of networking services
  • Implement basic communications services using socket programming
  • Understand basic principles of network security: public/private key encryption, signatures, hashing, Message authentication, Email Security (PGP), securing of TCP (SSL), IPSec and VPN.
  • Be aware of the challenges to be solved by future networking technology.

  • Understand basic principles of network security: public/private key encryption, signatures, hashing, Message authentication, Email Security (PGP), securing of TCP (SSL), IPSec and VPN.
  • Be aware of the challenges to be solved by future networking technology.

  • Understand basic principles of network security: public/private key encryption, signatures, hashing, Message authentication, Email Security (PGP), securing of TCP (SSL), IPSec and VPN.
  • Be aware of the challenges to be solved by future networking technology.

content.fi: This course provides a theoretical and practical basis for computer networking. Besides basic networking principles, the course provides case studies of network protocols at each layer of the OSI model. Examples include HTTP and TCP/IP for data center networking, Bluetooth and Bluetooth Low Energy for short-distance device-to-device communication, and symmetric and asymmetric encryption protocols and VPN for secure communications.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: ELEC-C7231 Fundamentals of Communications or similar knowledge, ELEC-E7120 Wireless Systems, basics of machine learning and MATLAB and/or python.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: ELEC-C7231 Fundamentals of Communications or similar knowledge, ELEC-E7120 Wireless Systems, basics of machine learning and MATLAB and/or python.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: ELEC-C7231 Fundamentals of Communications or similar knowledge, ELEC-E7120 Wireless Systems, basics of machine learning and MATLAB and/or python.

learningOutcomes.fi: Communication system design has traditionally relied on developing a mathematical model and producing optimized algorithms for that model. However, with the increasing access to data and computing resources, a data-driven approach based on machine learning has gained interest in recent years.  This course provides a brief introduction to machine learning that is tailored for communication and information theory researchers.   Key concepts of machine learning will be introduced and exemplified with applications in communications.
learningOutcomes.sv: Communication system design has traditionally relied on developing a mathematical model and producing optimized algorithms for that model. However, with the increasing access to data and computing resources, a data-driven approach based on machine learning has gained interest in recent years.  This course provides a brief introduction to machine learning that is tailored for communication and information theory researchers.   Key concepts of machine learning will be introduced and exemplified with applications in communications.
learningOutcomes.en: Communication system design has traditionally relied on developing a mathematical model and producing optimized algorithms for that model. However, with the increasing access to data and computing resources, a data-driven approach based on machine learning has gained interest in recent years.  This course provides a brief introduction to machine learning that is tailored for communication and information theory researchers.   Key concepts of machine learning will be introduced and exemplified with applications in communications.

content.fi:
This course consists of the following modules:
Module I: Channel Models:
Machine learning methods are data hungry and to obtain reliable results huge amount of real world measurements are needed.   This problem can be circumvented by  synthetic data which mimics the behavior of realistic channels. Channel models appropriate for Fifth Generation (5G) and Beyond Fifth Generation (B5G) systems will be studied. Channel model characteristics including path loss, large-scale fading, small-scale fading models and spatial consistency will be discussed.  The  differences of Milimeter-Wave and microwave models  will be  explained.  Several radio channel simulators  will be introduced.
Module II: Massive MIMO and Beam Management:
Massive multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) is an important technology in 5G and B5G  systems. Beam management procedures are used to acquire and maintain a set of beam pair links (a beam used at gNB paired with a beam used at user equipment). These procedures aim to maintain high-quality communication links despite challenges like path loss, blockages, and rapid changes in user equipment position and orientation.  We  will discuss  some use cases of applying machine learning for beam management in future communication systems.
 
Module III: Radio-frequency Positioning:
Location awareness is essential for enabling location based services and for improving network management in future communication systems. We will discuss the use of radio frequency  based approaches to localization. We review the radio frequency  features and techniques  that can be utilized for positioning. We will discuss the challenges for indoor positioning and utilize machine learning techniques to address these challenges.
Module IV: Channel Charting and Applications:
Channel charting is a self-supervised machine learning framework,  that  is applied to  the channel state information  of the users in  wireless systems  to create a logical radio map of radio environment. The  channel  chart  can be  then used for several  radio resource management applications. We will study   dimensionality reduction techniques   that  can be used for channel charting  and discuss several  radio resource management applications based on  channel charting.
 
Module V:   Neural Network Structures and Applications
We will study neural network structures and concepts   to jointly optimize the transmitter and receiver in communication system  by a single process.  We will utilize the  autoencoder structure to represent the end-to-end  communication system.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course, you
  • will be familiar with key practices in design and design thinking as well as a range of case examples of applying these in innovation initiatives
  • can describe key considerations for future focused thinking and innovation
  • can identify appropriate conditions to utilize select design thinking and/or design methods

learningOutcomes.en:

  • can describe key considerations for future focused thinking and innovation
  • can identify appropriate conditions to utilize select design thinking and/or design methods

content.fi:
This self-study online course introduces students to design thinking as a process for human-centred creative problem solving. With modules including case examples from organizations as well as introductory videos to different tools and methods, the course offers students the opportunity to explore the basics as well as contemporary issues in using design thinking approaches to improve innovation outcomes.
The amount of study credits depends on the number of online modules chosen by the student.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course you will
  • have an understanding of the role of co-creation in development processes and creative work
  • know and be able to utilize diverse idea generation and selection tools and methods
  • understand key concepts and dynamics of teamwork in creative work and development projects
  • recognize common pitfalls and know how to foster productive creative collaboration

content.fi:
This self-study online course focuses on effective ideation and collaboration in creative projects. The modules focus on idea generation, different tools and methods to enhance creating solutions to varying problems, as well as fostering creativity in collaborative creative work. Students will learn about key concepts affecting teamwork in e.g. product development projects, and learn to identify and mitigate typical pitfalls.
The amount of study credits depends on the number of online modules chosen by the student.

prerequisites.sv: Basic courses in strategic management
prerequisites.en: Basic courses in strategic management

learningOutcomes.fi:
Students will learn to - understand the core elements of strategy formulation, such as analysis of the external environment, alternative creation, alternative evaluation, and choice
- understand how process-related choices influence the quality of strategy formulation and execution and apply this knowledge to make informed choices
- understand how psychological dynamics influence strategy formulation and execution and consider and reflect how they can improve the such psychological dynamics
- understand how structural factors influence strategy formulation and execution and make informed choices regarding structure
- understand how artificial intelligence and data-analytics might influence strategy formulation and execution and develop preliminary ideas of how they could be applied in practice - apply their understanding in the planning of a case company strategy process - use PowerPoint for presenting ideas concisely

In addition, students will learn to critically evaluate academic articles on management, develop their own ideas, and present them in a clear way

learningOutcomes.en: The course will strengthen the student s ability to apply the theoretical basis and methods of his field in multidisciplinary contexts working as part of a group whose members have different backgrounds. After having completed the course the student will have a better understanding on  solving real-world problems in Life Science Technologies and to have learned to work as a member of a multidisciplinary expert team.

name.fi: How to lie with statistics? D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: How to lie with statistics? D, Föreläsning
name.en: How to lie with statistics? D, Lecture

workload.fi:
The course consists of 12 lectures, lecture assignments, project work and study journal. Majority of the lectures, instead of traditional lecturing, consists of discussions. Students find problematic data examples themselves and their findings and ideas for improving data analyses are discussed during the lectures. Students also learn to defend their ideas and discoveries by conducting their project works, where statistical analyses are used in justifying opinions and claims. In addition, students write a study journal. In the study journals students may write down notes about their thoughts and reactions to what has been discussed. Writing and submitting a study journal on time is compulsory for completing the course.
Majority of students' workload will come from independent assignments. Lecture assignments will take on average 7*10 = 70 hours to complete. That includes finding representative data examples and observing problems in them. Writing the study journal takes on average 20-25 h as total. Project work will take on average about 15-25 h. Attending the lectures takes as total 24 h.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: At least one intermediate level statistics course (preferably MS-C1620 Statistical Inference or equivalent). Being familiar with typical measures of location and scatter, graphical presentation of data, statistical testing, and regression analysis.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: At least one intermediate level statistics course (preferably MS-C1620 Statistical Inference or equivalent). Being familiar with typical measures of location and scatter, graphical presentation of data, statistical testing, and regression analysis.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: At least one intermediate level statistics course (preferably MS-C1620 Statistical Inference or equivalent). Being familiar with typical measures of location and scatter, graphical presentation of data, statistical testing, and regression analysis.

learningOutcomes.fi: The objectives are to learn to evaluate statistical analyses critically, to learn to avoid typical pitfalls in simple statistical analyses and to learn to improve presentation of the results obtained in statistical analyses. The objective is not to learn to lie with statistics, but to learn to spot if there is something fishy in a statistical analysis. The ultimate goal is to learn to tell the truth with statistics.
learningOutcomes.sv: The objectives are to learn to evaluate statistical analyses critically, to learn to avoid typical pitfalls in simple statistical analyses and to learn to improve presentation of the results obtained in statistical analyses. The objective is not to learn to lie with statistics, but to learn to spot if there is something fishy in a statistical analysis. The ultimate goal is to learn to tell the truth with statistics.

content.fi: During this course, students talk about typical problems and faults in sample selection, choices of location measure, graphical presentation of data, forming questionnaires, statistical testing, and regression analysis. Students are assumed to be familiar with these methods before attending the course. The focus will be on examples about using these methods wrongly --- either accidentally or on purpose --- and on improving statistical analyses.

workload.fi: Luento/työpajatyöskentely 3 tuntia, reflektiivinen kirjoittaminen 8-12 tuntia, yksilöllinen työskentely ja kokemusten saaminen vapaaehtoistehtävässä 67-70 tuntia.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar 3 timmar, reflekterande essä skrivning 8-12 timmar, individuellt arbete som volontär 67-70 timmar.
workload.en: Lecture/workshop 3 hours, reflective essay writing 8-12 hours, individual work in voluntary role 67-70 hours

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija:
1. Ymmärtää paremmin millä tavoin yhteistyö, viestintä ja päätöksenteko toteutuvat vapaaehtoisjärjestössä, yhdistyksessä tai akateemisessa yhteisössä
2. Osaa toimia rakentavammin erilaisissa vuorovaikutustilanteissa ja ymmärtää paremmin yhteisön ja ryhmän vuorovaikutukseen ja yhteistyöhön vaikuttavia tekijöitä
3. Osaa suunnitella ja toteuttaa paremmin vapaaehtoistoimintaan ja yliopiston luottamustoimintaan liittyviä keskeisiä tehtäviä (esim. tapahtumajärjestäminen, opetussuunnitelmatyö, tiedottaminen ja vaikuttaminen)
4. Pystyy tunnistamaan ja toteuttamaan aiempaa paremmin erilaisia vaikuttamisen muotoja erilaisissa vuorovaikutustilanteissa
5. Pystyy tunnistamaan ja kuvaamaan omia vahvuuksiaan ja kehittymistarpeitaan yhteistyön, viestinnän, vaikuttamisen ja ryhmässä toimimisen osalta.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avklarad kurs kan studenten:
1. Förstår bättre hur samarbete och beslutsfattande fungerar inom en voluntär organisation, föreningen eller ett akademiskt samfund2. Agera på ett konstruktivt sätt i olika sociala situationer 3. Planera och utföra bättre olika väsentliga uppgifter relaterade till den egna ansvarspositionen (t.ex. organisering av evenemang, läroplansarbete, kommunikation och samarbete)4. Bättre känna igen olika sorters inflytande i olika interaktionssituationer5. Identifiera och beskriva sin styrka och sitt utvecklingsbehov i förhållande till sin förtroendeposition
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, a student
1) Understands better the dynamics and mechanisms of decision making and collaboration in a community
2) Can act in a constructive way in various social situations
3) Can plan and execute better different essential tasks related to the own position of responsibility
4) Can recognise relevant and appropriate ways to influence and interact in different social situations
5) Can recognise and describe own strengths and developmental needs related to interaction and influencing

content.fi: Kurssin sisältönä on opiskelijan vapaaehtoistehtävässä opiskelijajärjestön tai yliopistohallinnon toimintatavoista, päätöksenteosta, yhteistyöstä ja toiminnasta saamiensa kokemusten reflektointi ja henkilökohtaisen oppimisen yhteenveto. Kurssin opintomateriaalit käsittelevät yhteisössä vaikuttamista sekä yhteistyön ja päätöksenteon dynamiikkaa.
content.sv: Kursen behandlar studentens volontärarbete inom studentorganisationen eller universitetsadministrationen.  Närmare reflekteras erfarenheterna av verksamheten, förfaringssätten, beslutsfattande och samarbete inom dessa. En sammanfattning görs av personligt lärande. Kursens studiematerial behandlar följande teman: hur man verkar inom samfund samt dynamiken i samarbete och beslutsfattande.
content.en: The core content of the course is to summarize and reflect on the lesson learned from leadership and collaboration experiences gained through the voluntary position of responsibility in student union, guild, or some other association or organization the student has been holding during the previous year. The course materials concern influencing in community, decision making and team dynamics.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää vuoden mittaista opiskelijajärjestön vapaaehtoistehtävässä tai yliopiston hallinnon opiskelijaedustajana toimimista, reflektioesseen kirjoittamista vapaaehtoisvuoden kokemuksista hyödyntäen kurssimateriaaleja sekä osallistumista vertaisseminaariin.
assesmentMethods.sv: Godkänd kurs kräver en arbetsprestation på ett år som volontär inom studentorganisationen eller  som utsedd studentrepresentant i universitetsadministrationen. Därtill ska studenten skriva en reflekterande essä om sina erfarenheter som volontär med hjälp av kursmaterialen samt delta i ett gruppseminarium.
assesmentMethods.en: The course requires one year experience in some position of responsibility in student union, guild, or similar voluntary association. Beside the experience gained through the volunteer work a student must write a reflective essay concerning the experience utilizing the course materials as references, and participate to three-hour peer workshop.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Kevät III  2025-2026 Kevät III Ilmoittautuminen: Kurssi on tarkoitettu opiskelijoille, jotka ovat toimineet vastuutehtävässä (hallituksen puheenjohtaja, hallituksen jäsenyys) ylioppilaskunnassa, ylioppilaskunnan alaisessa jaostossa tai toimikunnassa, tai muussa opiskelijayhdistyksessä (kilta, ainejärjestö, harrastekerho), tai ovat toimineet opiskelijaedustajana yliopiston sääntömääräisessä tai yliopiston muutoin asettamassa toimielimessä (yliopiston tai korkeakoulun akateeminen komitea, koulutusneuvosto, tutkintolautakunta tai vastaava) vuoden ajan.
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket: finska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Vår III  2025-2026 Vår III Anmälan: Kursen är avsedd för studeranden som har haft en ansvarsposition under ett år som styrelseordförande eller styrelseledamot i studentkåren,  en studentkårs avdelning, kommitté eller annan studentförening (gille, ämnesförening, hobby klubb) eller har fungerat som studentrepresentant i ett stadgeenligt universitets organ eller i ett annat av universitetet tillsatt organ (universitetets eller högskolans kommitté för akademiska ärenden, utbildningsråd, examensnämnd eller motsvarande).
additionalInformation.en: Teaching Language: Finnish Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Spring III  2025-2026 Spring III Registration: The course is aimed for students who has been serving in position of responsibility in Student Union of Aalto University (chairman, board member etc.), in some student club or Guild during the previous year, or as student representative in University administrative bodies during the previous year.

name.fi: Radiation damage in materials D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Radiation damage in materials D, Föreläsning
name.en: Radiation damage in materials D, Lecture

workload.fi: lectures, exercise sessions, project work, independent work
workload.sv: lectures, exercise sessions, project work, independent work
workload.en: lectures, exercise sessions, project work, independent work

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Materials physics basics (e.g. PHYS-C0240 Materiaalifysiikka or similar)
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Materials physics basics (e.g. PHYS-C0240 Materiaalifysiikka or similar)
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Materials physics basics (e.g. PHYS-C0240 Materiaalifysiikka or similar)

learningOutcomes.fi:
The goal is to understand the basic physics governing the accumulation of radiation damage in materials, when and where radiation effects need to be considered, and how the radiation damage affects the physical and mechanical properties of materials.   After the course, the student will be able to
  • list the different types of defects induced by radiation in different materials
  • estimate quantitatively whether a given radiation source will cause displacement damage in a material
  • calculate the radiation dose in an irradiated sample in terms of displacements per atom, and the nominal vacancy concentration after a given radiation dose
  • determine whether simple point defects are mobile in a given material under given conditions
  • explain the differences between radiation damage formation and evolution in terms of time scales, and the challenges this poses for experimental validation of radiation damage models
  • describe the effects of radiation damage on the physical and mechanical properties of materials
  • critically discuss the benefits and limitations of models of radiation effects, and the challenges to sustainable nuclear energy in terms of model predictive capability and the need for the development of new materials with superior thermo-mechanical properties and radiation resistance
learningOutcomes.sv:
The goal is to understand the basic physics governing the accumulation of radiation damage in materials, when and where radiation effects need to be considered, and how the radiation damage affects the physical and mechanical properties of materials.   After the course, the student will be able to
  • list the different types of defects induced by radiation in different materials
  • estimate quantitatively whether a given radiation source will cause displacement damage in a material
  • calculate the radiation dose in an irradiated sample in terms of displacements per atom, and the nominal vacancy concentration after a given radiation dose
  • determine whether simple point defects are mobile in a given material under given conditions
  • explain the differences between radiation damage formation and evolution in terms of time scales, and the challenges this poses for experimental validation of radiation damage models
  • describe the effects of radiation damage on the physical and mechanical properties of materials
  • critically discuss the benefits and limitations of models of radiation effects, and the challenges to sustainable nuclear energy in terms of model predictive capability and the need for the development of new materials with superior thermo-mechanical properties and radiation resistance
learningOutcomes.en:
The goal is to understand the basic physics governing the accumulation of radiation damage in materials, when and where radiation effects need to be considered, and how the radiation damage affects the physical and mechanical properties of materials.   After the course, the student will be able to
  • list the different types of defects induced by radiation in different materials
  • estimate quantitatively whether a given radiation source will cause displacement damage in a material
  • calculate the radiation dose in an irradiated sample in terms of displacements per atom, and the nominal vacancy concentration after a given radiation dose
  • determine whether simple point defects are mobile in a given material under given conditions
  • explain the differences between radiation damage formation and evolution in terms of time scales, and the challenges this poses for experimental validation of radiation damage models
  • describe the effects of radiation damage on the physical and mechanical properties of materials
  • critically discuss the benefits and limitations of models of radiation effects, and the challenges to sustainable nuclear energy in terms of model predictive capability and the need for the development of new materials with superior thermo-mechanical properties and radiation resistance

content.fi: The radiation damage event, concepts of BCA, TDE, and dpa, point defects and extended defects, thermodynamics of point defects, collision cascades, defect migration and microstructural evolution, precipitation and segregation, swelling, hardening and embrittlement

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: BSc-level basic studies in mathematics and programming.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: BSc-level basic studies in mathematics and programming.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: BSc-level basic studies in mathematics and programming.

learningOutcomes.fi: This course introduces you to the logical formalization of mathematical reasoning and to the mathematics of computational intractability. You learn to work with and reason using propositional logic and first-order logic. You learn how to prove that a computational problem is at least as hard as another computational problem by presenting an efficient reduction from the latter to the former. You know the problem classes P and NP, as well as the hardest problems in the class NP, namely the NP-complete problems. You learn how to prove that a computational problem is NP-complete.
learningOutcomes.sv: This course introduces you to the logical formalization of mathematical reasoning and to the mathematics of computational intractability. You learn to work with and reason using propositional logic and first-order logic. You learn how to prove that a computational problem is at least as hard as another computational problem by presenting an efficient reduction from the latter to the former. You know the problem classes P and NP, as well as the hardest problems in the class NP, namely the NP-complete problems. You learn how to prove that a computational problem is NP-complete.
learningOutcomes.en: This course introduces you to the logical formalization of mathematical reasoning and to the mathematics of computational intractability. You learn to work with and reason using propositional logic and first-order logic. You learn how to prove that a computational problem is at least as hard as another computational problem by presenting an efficient reduction from the latter to the former. You know the problem classes P and NP, as well as the hardest problems in the class NP, namely the NP-complete problems. You learn how to prove that a computational problem is NP-complete.

content.fi: Propositional logic and first-order logic. Formulas, models, validity, satisfiability; axioms and proofs, soundness and completeness; logic circuits. Computational hardness, reductions between problems, the classes P and NP; NP-completeness, the Cook-Levin Theorem.
content.sv: Propositional logic and first-order logic. Formulas, models, validity, satisfiability; axioms and proofs, soundness and completeness; logic circuits. Computational hardness, reductions between problems, the classes P and NP; NP-completeness, the Cook-Levin Theorem.
content.en: Propositional logic and first-order logic. Formulas, models, validity, satisfiability; axioms and proofs, soundness and completeness; logic circuits. Computational hardness, reductions between problems, the classes P and NP; NP-completeness, the Cook-Levin Theorem.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course a student will
  • Have an in-depth understanding what IEM as a professional field is about and what is required from them to become a future responsible IEM professional
  • Have built a strong understanding of the open-ended nature of the problems that IEM professionals are confronted with and recognized the need to continuously develop their personal and professional competence
  • Have gained a solid view of future career prospects of an IEM professionals
  • Have gained a stronger sense of belonging to the IEM community as a whole

content.fi: This course serves as an integrative course for first-year IEM master’s students that brings together all students enrolled in the program. Through a series of workshops with fellow students, alumni of the program and IEM faculty, the course establishes a basis for personal as well as professional development and lifelong learning and helps students reflect about their future career prospects as well as what it means to be a responsible member of the IEM community.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: BSc level skills in mathematics, and in physics or electrical engineering

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course student can
  • Explain how various physical quantities are measured (metrology) and transduced into electrical variables in typical physics experiment.
  • Analyze basic active electronic circuits for measurements and select components for optimal functioning.
  • Design a simple filtering circuit with both passive and active components, and explain the basic working principle of phase-sensitive detection.
  • Explain the basic working principles of the most common temperature, pressure and displacement sensors as well as the most common vacuum pumps and cryogenic equipment.
  • Explain how to protect the measurements from resistive, capacitive and inductive coupling of noise.
  • Apply the concepts of amplifier noise and measurement sensitivity in order to figure out if a given quantity is measurable.
  • Design an optical setup for light manipulation and detection
  • Explain the principle of common optical techniques and the functioning of common optical elements

After the course student can

  • Explain how to protect the measurements from resistive, capacitive and inductive coupling of noise.
  • Apply the concepts of amplifier noise and measurement sensitivity in order to figure out if a given quantity is measurable.
  • Design an optical setup for light manipulation and detection
  • Explain the principle of common optical techniques and the functioning of common optical elements

  • Explain the basic working principles of the most common temperature, pressure and displacement sensors as well as the most common vacuum pumps and cryogenic equipment.
  • Explain how to protect the measurements from resistive, capacitive and inductive coupling of noise.

  • Design an optical setup for light manipulation and detection
  • Explain the principle of common optical techniques and the functioning of common optical elements

content.fi: The course reviews methods, practices and data processing needed in experimental physics research. Topics addressed include metrology, electronics (sensors, amplifiers, filters), optics (lasers/light sources, optical elements, detectors), semiconductor physics, nanofabrication methods, measurement systems, vacuum technology, cryogenic techniques, and thermometry.
content.sv: The course reviews methods, practices and data processing needed in experimental physics research. Topics addressed include metrology, electronics (sensors, amplifiers, filters), optics (lasers/light sources, optical elements, detectors), semiconductor physics, nanofabrication methods, measurement systems, vacuum technology, cryogenic techniques, and thermometry.
content.en: The course reviews methods, practices and data processing needed in experimental physics research. Topics addressed include metrology, electronics (sensors, amplifiers, filters), optics (lasers/light sources, optical elements, detectors), semiconductor physics, nanofabrication methods, measurement systems, vacuum technology, cryogenic techniques, and thermometry.

learningOutcomes.fi: Opit keskeisimmät perusteet havaitsemisen, ajattelun ja tunteiden hermostollisesta perustasta. Opit myös perusteet aivojen anatomiasta, hermosolujen toiminnasta sekä keskeisimmistä aivotutkimusmenetelmistä. Oppimasi avulla pystyt opiskelemaan itsenäisesti aihealueella ja soveltamaan oppimaasi tekniikan alueella.
learningOutcomes.sv: Du kommer att lära dig grunderna i den neurala grunden för perception, tänkande och känslor. Du kommer också att lära dig grunderna i hjärnans anatomi, nervcellsfunktion och de viktigaste hjärnforskningsmetoderna. Med ditt lärande kommer du att kunna studera självständigt inom ämnesområdet och tillämpa det du har lärt dig inom teknikområdet.
learningOutcomes.en: You will learn the basics of the neural basis of perception, thinking, and emotion. You will also learn the basics of brain anatomy, nerve cell function, and the most important brain research methods. With your learning, you will be able to study independently in the subject area and apply what you have learned in the field of technology.

content.fi: Kurssi esittelee aivoanatomian, hermosolukon toiminnan sekä havaitsemisen, ajattelun ja tunteiden hermostolllisen perustan peruskäsitteistöä.
content.sv: Kursen introducerar de grundläggande begreppen hjärnans anatomi, neuronal funktion och den neurala grunden för perception, tänkande och känslor.
content.en: The course introduces the basic concepts of brain anatomy, neuronal function, and the neural basis of perception, thinking, and emotion.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: TU-A1100 Tuotantotalous 1
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: TU-A1100 Produktionsekonomi 1
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: TU-A1100 Industrial Engineering and Management 1

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa:
  • muotoilla työsuunnitelman toteutettavaan kehitystehtävään liittyen
  • hakea, kerätä ja analysoida kehitystehtävään liittyvää relevanttia tietoa
  • tuottaa perustellun ratkaisuehdotuksen kehitystehtävään liittyen
  • raportoida suullisesti ja kirjallisesti kehitystehtävän ja siihen liittyvän ratkaisun keskeisen sisällön.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Studerande ska efter avklarad kurs kunna:
  • formulera en arbetsplan relaterad till den utvecklingsuppgift som genomförs
  • söka, samla in och analysera relevant information relaterad till utvecklingsuppgiften
  • ge en motiverad lösning på utvecklingsuppgiften
  • rapportera huvudinnehållet i utvecklingsuppgiften och dess lösning muntligt och skriftligt.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course is completed the student will be able to:
  • formulate a work plan for a development project
  • search, gather and analyse relevant information related to the task at hand
  • produce a validated solution suggestion for the company
  • report both orally and in writing the essential content of the solution.

content.fi: Kurssi käsittelee tietointensiivisten yritysten johtamista. Kurssi perehdyttää opiskelijat nopeasti kehittyvien toimialojen erityiskysymyksiin liiketoimintaympäristön, liiketoimintaprosessien sekä organisaatiokäyttäytymisen näkökulmista. Kurssi käsittelee tietointensiivisten yritysten ja organisaatioiden strategiaan, operaatioihin ja ihmisten johtamiseen liittyviä tuotantotaloudellisia haasteita. Ryhmissä ratkaistavat tosielämän kehitystehtävät perehdyttävät opiskelijat nopeasti kehittyvien toimialojen erityiskysymyksiin liiketoimintaympäristön, liiketoimintaprosessien sekä organisaatiokäyttäytymisen näkökulmista.
content.sv: Kursen behandlar ledarskap och management inom kunskapsintensiva företag. Kursen introducerar studeranden till affärsverksamhet inom snabbt utvecklande informations- och kommunikationsintensiva branscher. Kursen behandlar kunskapsintensiva företags och organisationers produktionsekonomiska utmaningar relaterade till strategier, operationer och ledarskap. På kursen görs grupparbeten där studeranden löser utvecklingsuppgifter som beskriver det verkliga livet. På detta sätt blir studeranden väl förtrogna med specialfrågor inom snabbt växande branschers företagsklimat, affärsprocesser och organisationsbeteende.
content.en: The course deals with strategy, operations management and leadership related challenges of knowledge intensive companies.

assesmentMethods.fi: Luennot, ryhmissä tehtävät välipalautukset, seminaariesitys ja loppuraportti. Kuhunkin työmuotoon sisältyy niin yksin- kuin ryhmätyöskentelyä. Kurssin suoritus perustuu aktiiviseen pienryhmätyöskentelyyn projektityössä, joka tehdään jonkin yrityksen tai organisaation kanssa läheisessä yhteistyössä. Luennoilla on läsnäolovelvollisuus. Poissaolot korvataan erillisillä tehtävillä.
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningar, som grupparbete gjorda mellanrapporter, seminariepresentation och slutrapport. I varje arbetsform ingår både individuellt arbete och grupparbete. Kursinsatsen baserar sig på aktivt projektarbete i små grupper. Projektarbetet utförs i nära samarbete med ett företag eller en organisation. Närvaro är obligatorisk på kursen. Frånvaro kompenseras med tilläggsuppgifter.
assesmentMethods.en: Lectures, assignments, presentation and report. The project work done in small groups and presentation of the results. Attendance at lectures is compulsory.

learningOutcomes.fi: The course gives a comprehensive overview of Gaussian processes (GPs) in machine learning. After the course, the student can recognize where GPs can be used and know their limitations as well as their theoretical underpinnings. The student is familiar with the most common approximative inference methods for GPs and is familiar with their contemporary use and applications.

content.fi: Gaussian processes (GPs) are a powerful machine learning paradigm for Bayesian nonparametric modelling. This course will give an overview of Gaussian processes in machine learning, and it provides both a theoretical and practical background for leveraging them. The course covers Gaussian process regression, classification, and unsupervised modelling, as well as a selection of more recent specialised topics. This is a more specialized course and assumes students already have a background in machine learning.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Familiarity with programming (knowledge of the C language is particularly advantageous), and basic knowledge of information security, e.g. as provided by the course "Information Security".

learningOutcomes.fi: After taking the course, students are familiar a variety of platform security mechanisms and implementation strategies.  They understand the security properties provided by features of modern software and hardware platforms, and are familiar with both their use and underlying implementation.
learningOutcomes.sv: After taking the course, students are familiar a variety of platform security mechanisms and implementation strategies.  They understand the security properties provided by features of modern software and hardware platforms, and are familiar with both their use and underlying implementation.
learningOutcomes.en: After taking the course, students are familiar a variety of platform security mechanisms and implementation strategies.  They understand the security properties provided by features of modern software and hardware platforms, and are familiar with both their use and underlying implementation.

content.fi: Many security courses are about how to design your application and configuration to keep your platform secure.  This course is the opposite: what can your platform do to make your application secure, and how does it do it?  In this course we will discuss the security features provided by modern platforms, and show how they are implemented.

name.en: Research Project in Engineering Psychology, Lecture

workload.fi: Itsenäinen työskentely, aloitus- sekä loppuluennot ja ohjaustuki. Tutkimusprojektin toteuttaminen ryhmätyönä.
workload.sv: Självständigt arbete, inledande och avslutande föreläsningar samt handledningsstöd. Genomförande av forskningsprojektet som grupparbete.
workload.en:
Independent work, introductory and final
lectures, and supervisory
support. Conducting a research project as a group work.

prerequisites.fi: Johdatus Teknilliseen psykologiaan, Cognitive Psychology, Research Methods in Engineering Psychology
prerequisites.sv: Introduktion till teknisk psykologi, Cognitive Psychology, Research Methods in Engineering Psychology
prerequisites.en: Introduction to Engineering Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Research Methods in Engineering Psychology

learningOutcomes.fi:
Osaat suunnitella kokeellisen tutkimuksen koeasetelman ja toteuttaa ja analysoida sen itsenäisesti. Osaat perustella
oman koeasetelmasi menetelmän ja tulokset.
learningOutcomes.sv: Du kan utforma en experimentell forskningsdesign, genomföra den självständigt och analysera resultaten. Du kan motivera din valda forskningsmetod och dess resultat.
learningOutcomes.en: You are able design an experimental research setup, carry it out independently, and analyze the results. You can justify your chosen research design, methodology, and findings.

content.fi: Kokeen suunnittelu, toteutus, raportointi ja analyysi. Itsenäinen kokeellisen tutkimuksen kokonaisuuden hallinta. Kurssi edellyttää aiemmin opittujen analyysimenetelmien, tilastotieteellisten tai laadullisten tutkimusmenetelmien soveltamista itsenäisessä kokeellisessa tutkimuksessa. Kurssi painottuu tutkimusprojektin suunnitteluun, hallintaan, analyysiin, kirjalliseen raportointiin ja tuloksien esittämiseen.
content.sv: Planering, genomförande, rapportering och analys av experiment. Självständig hantering av den experimentella forskningsprocessen som helhet. Kursen kräver tillämpning av tidigare inlärda analysmetoder, antingen statistiska eller kvalitativa forskningsmetoder, i en självständig experimentell studie. Kursen fokuserar på planering, hantering och analys av ett forskningsprojekt, skriftlig rapportering samt presentation av resultaten.
content.en: Experiment design, implementation, reporting, and analysis. Independent management of the experimental research process. The course requires applying previously learned analytical methods, either statistical or qualitative research methods, in an independent experimental study. The course focuses on research project planning, management, analysis, written reporting, and presenting the findings.

assesmentMethods.fi: Arviointi painottuu tutkimusprojektin itsenäiseen suorittamiseen, tutkimustuloksien raportoimiseen ja esittämiseen opittujen kurssisisältöjen tukemana. Tarkemmat arviointiperusteet ilmoitetaan kurssin aloituksessa.
assesmentMethods.sv: Bedömningen fokuserar på självständigt genomförande av forskningsprojektet, rapportering och presentation av forskningsresultaten, med stöd av kursinnehållet. De detaljerade bedömningskriterierna meddelas vid kursstarten.
assesmentMethods.en: Evaluation focuses on the independent completion of the research project, the reporting and presentation of research findings, supported by the course content. Detailed assessment criteria will be provided at the course start.

learningOutcomes.fi: This course has two major purposes. One is to provide an overview of the fundamental themes in research on strategy, venturing, operations, and organizations, and introduce contemporary topics within these areas. The other purpose is to expose the participants to the various methodological and research practice approaches (conducting research, synthesizing, and setting up manuscripts) in this domain. Overall, after the course, the students should have a broad understanding of the research areas in strategy, venturing, operations, and organizations and what is required for publishing research in top-tier journals in these areas. More specifically, after the course, the participant should (1) know the most important articles and in the area of strategy, venturing, and organizations (2) understand how the different streams of research have evolved over time and how they are connected to each other, and (3) be able to project the future development of the research from the perspective of one's own doctoral work. The course will further provide a setting for developing a variety of skills in research on strategy, venturing and organizations such as synthesizing research, research designs, and what constitutes a theoretical contribution in the various domains of strategy, venturing, operations, and organizations.

The course will further provide a setting for developing a variety of skills in research on strategy, venturing and organizations such as synthesizing research, research designs, and what constitutes a theoretical contribution in the various domains of strategy, venturing, operations, and organizations.

The course will further provide a setting for developing a variety of skills in research on strategy, venturing and organizations such as synthesizing research, research designs, and what constitutes a theoretical contribution in the various domains of strategy, venturing, operations, and organizations.

content.fi: The course covers some of the fundamental themes of research on strategy, venturing, operations, and organizations, and introduces a selected set of contemporary topics in these areas in a seminar format during period IV-V. The themes are covered by reviewing articles that provide the key milestones of each theme.

learningOutcomes.fi: The aim of the course is to to develop participants thinking and analytical skills in various ethical issues related to digitalization and to to assume a critical attitude towards promises of moral improvement through digitalization; and to see digitalization and related technologies in their wider social, environmental and political contexts.
learningOutcomes.sv: The aim of the course is to to develop participants thinking and analytical skills in various ethical issues related to digitalization and to to assume a critical attitude towards promises of moral improvement through digitalization; and to see digitalization and related technologies in their wider social, environmental and political contexts.

content.fi: The course will pursue a cross-disciplinary investigation of the socio-ethical implications of digital technologies. We will combine theoretical viewpoints with concrete issues facing people who are implementing digital systems. We will cover a variety of themes, including data ownership and control, digital economics and surveillance capitalism, power and governance of algorithmic decision making, humanization of digital technology, ethics of robotics and autonomous systems and sustainablity of digital development in general.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Students should have basic knowledge about software systems, distributed computing and software development, e.g., cloud computing, big data, operating systems, distributed systems and machine learning. Therefore, it is important that students have passed courses with these topics, such as "Cloud Computing", "Big Data Platforms", "Operating Systems", and "Machine Learning". Students who have not completed such courses can still join the course after having the interview with the teacher in charge. Note that prerequisite might change a bit each year as the topics discussed in the course are not the same every year.

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course focuses on advanced topics in software systems. The topics will be centered around software systems techniques for edge-cloud continum, distributed and end-to-end machine learning, and new continuum computing models, such as cloud-hpc-quantum integration.  The study is centered around researching new ideas, evaluating existing techniques, optimizing systems and exploring new solutions. Students will be able to:
  • classify and explain state of the art of systems requirements for big data and ML in edge-cloud continuum
  • analyze and apply key metrics and system designs of Big Data/ML applications and services
  • define and develop reliability and performance monitoring and analysis of systems for big data and ML
  • apply and evaluate key programming models and frameworks for Big Data/ML
  • produce and evaluate edge system designs for Big Data and ML systems
  • present and discuss new hardware architectures and quantum for Big Data/ML
  • present and discuss future perspectives on systems for Big Data/ML

content.fi:
The course of Advanced Topics in Software Systems has selected topics, being updated yearly. For the period 2024-2026, the course will focus on the following areas:
  • Quality of analytics for end-to-end ML systems and services
  • Design and evaluation for systems robustness, reliability, resilience and elasticity for Big Data and distributed/realtime ML (with also engineering work)
  • Test, debug, monitoring, and configuration management (with also engineering work)
  • Dataflows and orchestration frameworks for Big Data/ML (with also engineering work)
  • Edge systems and edge-cloud continuum for Big Data/ML (with also engineering work)
  • New hardware architectures and quantum systems for Big Data/ML (more on the concepts and state-of-the-art)

assesmentMethods.fi:
The assessment of the course will be based on the follow activities:
  • study log and contributing topic identification, pass with >=50% positive
  • study log and assessment of other work, pass with >= 50% positive
  • a selected topic and its presentation of  a concept, design principles, tools, pass with >= 50% positive
  • identificaton of  an open problem and the project work for the problem with in-depth technical design, prototype and/evaluation, pass with >=50% positive, excellent if the result is novel.
A student will pass the course if the student has 4 passes and will pass with excellent if the last activity leads to some novel results. Note that in Aalto officially we have only pass/fail. The teacher will find a suitable way to recognize "pass with excellent" (e.g., mark a note or give a certificate issued by the professor personally).

learningOutcomes.fi:
The goal is to understand the physics and technology of solar energy utilization, including thermal and electric applications, at a level adequate for needs found in practical or academic environments. After the course, students will be able to
  • Estimate the available solar radiation based on physical, geographical and atmospheric factors
  • Explain the daily and seasonal variation of solar irradiance and how they affect the design of photovoltaic and solar thermal systems
  • Evaluate the effect of solar tracking and concentration on the amount of collected radiation
  • Explain the working principle of photovoltaic cells and solar thermal collectors (below devices) in terms of the underlying physical phenomena and device structure
  • Name the most important performance loss mechanisms, and explain how they depend on the materials and structural properties of the devices
  • Describe and analyze the performance characteristics and energy conversion efficiency of the devices through a physical model, and use it to interpret experimental results
  • Design and size photovoltaic and solar thermal systems with or without local energy storage
  • Use central tools of solar energy engineering, such as solar angle calculations, meteorological irradiance databases, solar collector performance models, current-voltage models of photovoltaic cells, optical and thermal models, etc., which solar energy utilization is often based on.

content.fi: Physical foundations and practical applications of solar energy. Solar radiation and its attenuation, radiation components, measuring and assessing solar radiation solar angles, tracking systems, interactions with materials, wavelength selective materials, solar thermal collector, HWB equation, photovoltaic effect, solar cell, equivalent circuit, concentrated solar radiation, CSP plants, solar energy systems and their components, assessing performance.

name.fi: Programming course on Monte Carlo particle transport simulations D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Programming course on Monte Carlo particle transport simulations D, Föreläsning
name.en: Programming course on Monte Carlo particle transport simulations D, Lecture

workload.fi: Course is completed via independent programming tasks.
workload.sv: Course is completed via independent programming tasks.
workload.en: Course is completed via independent programming tasks.

prerequisites.fi: Basic programming skills, introductory level courses on nuclear engineering.
prerequisites.sv: Basic programming skills, introductory level courses on nuclear engineering.
prerequisites.en: Basic programming skills, introductory level courses on nuclear engineering.

learningOutcomes.fi: The course provides the skills to understand the computational methods used for Monte Carlo particle transport simulations. Monte Carlo codes are widely used as general-purpose calculation tools for particle and radiation transport applications in nuclear engineering, medical physics, fusion and space research. The course topics are focused on neutron transport and reactor physics, but the covered methods also apply to other radiation transport problems.
learningOutcomes.sv: The course provides the skills to understand the computational methods used for Monte Carlo particle transport simulations. Monte Carlo codes are widely used as general-purpose calculation tools for particle and radiation transport applications in nuclear engineering, medical physics, fusion and space research. The course topics are focused on neutron transport and reactor physics, but the covered methods also apply to other radiation transport problems.
learningOutcomes.en: The course provides the skills to understand the computational methods used for Monte Carlo particle transport simulations. Monte Carlo codes are widely used as general-purpose calculation tools for particle and radiation transport applications in nuclear engineering, medical physics, fusion and space research. The course topics are focused on neutron transport and reactor physics, but the covered methods also apply to other radiation transport problems.

content.fi: The course consists of five introductory lectures and programming exercises, during which the students gradually develop a simplified Monte Carlo transport calculation code. The exercise topics are related to collection of statistical results, geometry and tracking routines used in Monte Carlo codes, handling of particle interactions, etc. The exercises are recommended to be completed using a compiled language (FORTRAN, C, C++, etc.), since interpreted languages such as Python are slow when used for numerical simulations.

prerequisites.en: MS-A03XX Differential and integral calculus 3.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student

- can identify certain problem types and pose them in a form suitable for numerical methods
- can choose an effective method for a given problem
- can estimate accuracy of the computed solutions
- understands the different factors affecting the accuracy of the solution

name.en: Computational Assignments in Applied Mathematics, Lecture

workload.fi: Lähiopetus 36h (3), läsnäolo on pakollistaItsenäinen työskentely 97h
workload.sv: Direktundervisning 36h (3), närvaron är oblikatoriskSjälvständiga studier 97h
workload.en: Contact hours 36h (3), attendance is compulsoryAutonomous studies 97h

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX, MS-A05XX
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX, MS-A05XX
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX, MS-A05XX

learningOutcomes.fi: Opintojakson suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa 1. käyttää kurssilla käsiteltyjä ohjelmistoja ja tarvittaessa laajentaa osaamistaan itsenäisesti 2. luokitella matemaattisia malleja ja valita käsiteltyjen ohjelmistojen joukosta parhaiten soveltuvan ohjelmiston tietyn matemaattisen mallin toteuttamiseen 3. toteuttaa ja ratkaista valmiiksi kuvatun yksinkertaisen matemaattisen mallin soveltuvalla ohjelmistolla 4. visualisoida mallin tuloksia ja viedä niitä julkaisuihin
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter att ha slutfört kursen kan studeranden 1. använda de programvaror som behandlats under kursen och vid behov utöka sina färdigheter självständigt 2. klassificera matematiska modeller och välja den lämpligaste av de behandlade programvarorna för att implementera en viss matematisk modell 3. implementera och lösa en given enkel matematisk modell med lämplig programvara 4. visualisera resultat från modellen och exportera dem till publikationer
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, the student can 1. use the software introduced on the course and expand his/her skills if need be, 2. classify mathematical models and choose software that suits modeling needs, 3. use software to implement and solve simple models, and 4. visualize models' results

content.fi: Käytettäviä ohjelmistoja ovat ainakin Matlab, Simulink, Mathematica, R ja Excel. Näillä ohjelmistoilla rakennetaan mm. diskreettiaikaisia simulointimalleja, regressiomalleja, optimointimalleja ja dynaamisia säätömalleja.
content.sv: Behandlade programvaror är åtminstone Matlab, Simulink, Mathematica, R och Excel. Med dessa program byggs bl.a. diskreta simuleringsmodeller, regressionsmodeller, optimeringsmodeller och dynamiska kontrollmodeller.
content.en: Studying of mathematical problem solving in tutorials dealing with, for example, discrete event simulation models, regression models, optimization models, and control models. Software used in the course include Matlab, Simulink, Mathematica, R and Excel.

assesmentMethods.fi: Ohjattu tietokoneluokkatyöskentely, itsenäiset harjoitustyöt ja loppukuulustelu.
assesmentMethods.sv: Handlett arbete i datorklasser, självständiga uppdrag och slutförhör.
assesmentMethods.en: Assignments.

substitutes.sv: Mat-2.2107 Datorarbeten i tillämpad matematik
substitutes.en: Mat-2.2107 Computational Assignments in Applied Mathematics

learningOutcomes.fi:
1. Understand how several important problems arising from diverse fields can be cast and solved as optimisation problems;
  2. Know the main techniques for solving large scale numerical optimisation problems and how to apply them in practice;
  3. Know how to use optimisation software for implementing and solving optimisation problems.
learningOutcomes.sv:
1. Understand how several important problems arising from diverse fields can be cast and solved as optimisation problems;
  2. Know the main techniques for solving large scale numerical optimisation problems and how to apply them in practice;
  3. Know how to use optimisation software for implementing and solving optimisation problems.
learningOutcomes.en:
1. Understand how several important problems arising from diverse fields can be cast and solved as optimisation problems;
  2. Know the main techniques for solving large scale numerical optimisation problems and how to apply them in practice;
  3. Know how to use optimisation software for implementing and solving optimisation problems.

content.fi: Concepts familiar from Calculus courses are connected with modern linear algebra. First convexity and methods applying computable second derivatives are discussed. The effect of linear constraint on the structure of the related linear systems of equations is covered in detail. The idea of minimisation via gradient descent including the practical randomised very large scale variants is introduced.

learningOutcomes.fi:
- The student understands the basic concepts of number theory and is able to perform modular arithmetics.
- The student understands the quadratic reciprocity law, one of the most important theorems in Number Theory.
- The student is familiar with some applications of Number Theory in Cryptography.

content.fi: Integer factorization, primes, pseudo primes, modular arithmetics, squares and nonsquares in modular arithmetics, quadratic reciprocity, primititive roots, continued fractions, applications to cryptography. Some of these topics are covered in the lecture program, some in the student projects.

learningOutcomes.fi: After this course a student will know basic methods in measure and integration theory.
learningOutcomes.sv: After this course a student will know basic methods in measure and integration theory.
learningOutcomes.en: After this course a student will know basic methods in measure and integration theory.

content.fi: Outer measure (properties of measurable sets, characterizations of measurable sets, Lebesgue outer measure), measurable functions (properties of measurable functions, approximation by simple functions, Egoroff and Lusin theorems), integration (construction and properties of integral, Lebesgue integral, convergence theorems), Fubini's theorem.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students learn to analyze and solve problems in linear algebra that occur often in scientific computing, data fitting and optimization. The main focus is on solution of sparse linear systems. After the course, the students can choose the best solution method for each problem and have a good understanding on issues related to numerical stability of the applied algorithms.

learningOutcomes.fi: You will learn to identify an ill-posed inverse problem and to understand the restrictions its nature imposes on the solution process. You will familiarize yourself with several classical regularization methods for finding approximate solutions to linear ill-posed problems. You will learn to formulate an inverse problem as a Bayesian problem of statistical inference and to interpret the information contained in the resulting posterior probability distribution. You will learn to numerically implement the introduced solution techniques.
learningOutcomes.sv: You will learn to identify an ill-posed inverse problem and to understand the restrictions its nature imposes on the solution process. You will familiarize yourself with several classical regularization methods for finding approximate solutions to linear ill-posed problems. You will learn to formulate an inverse problem as a Bayesian problem of statistical inference and to interpret the information contained in the resulting posterior probability distribution. You will learn to numerically implement the introduced solution techniques.
learningOutcomes.en: You will learn to identify an ill-posed inverse problem and to understand the restrictions its nature imposes on the solution process. You will familiarize yourself with several classical regularization methods for finding approximate solutions to linear ill-posed problems. You will learn to formulate an inverse problem as a Bayesian problem of statistical inference and to interpret the information contained in the resulting posterior probability distribution. You will learn to numerically implement the introduced solution techniques.

content.fi: The course s topic is computational methods for solving inverse problems arising from practical applications. The course consists of two parts: the first three weeks focus on classic regularization techniques, the latter three weeks discuss statistical methods.
